main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were observed on radar in the Mediterranean area on 16 December 1953. The objects were stationary and appeared as blips on ground radar, varying in shape and range from 60-80 miles from the station.
interesting points: The observation was made by military personnel using ground radar, adding credibility to the report.
The objects were described as varying in shape, green-gray in color, and metallic with a shiny surface, indicating a physical presence.
The radar return was initially thought to be anomalous propagation, subterranean radar jamming, or geese/troops in flight, but no definite conclusion was reached.
The observed objects were estimated to be traveling at 200 to 300 MPH with excellent maneuverability, exceeding the capabilities of known aircraft at that time.
The report mentions that the observation was downgraded and declassified at specific intervals after the initial 12 years, suggesting ongoing official interest in the event.
sighted object: multiple unidentified flying objects on ground radar
